intro: Amaioua longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed amaioua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and are borne in dense inflorescences. Due to its restricted distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
